thread.title: Plans for 'English votes for English laws' have passed the vote in the House of Commons | Border
thread.title_full: Plans for 'English votes for English laws' have passed the vote in the House of Commons | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Plans for 'English votes for English laws' have passed the vote in the House of Commons | Border
text:
Westminster Credit: PA A motion to answer the 'West Lothian question', whereby Scottish MPs are entitled to vote on English laws but English MPs cannot vote on matters that have been devolved to Holyrood, has been passed through the House of Commons.
The plans will create a 'grand committee', where English laws will be scrutinised without the influence or attendance of Scottish or Northern Irish MPs.
English MPs will have the power to veto any motions that come before the grand committee before they go to a vote in the House of Commons, which will include MPs from across the United Kingdom.
Last updated Thu 22 Oct 2015 Politics Cumbria Scotland Dumfries and Galloway Scottish Borders
